com.ibm.async_util.locks

Class FairAsyncSemaphore

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.async_util.locks.FairAsyncSemaphore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AsyncSemaphore

    public class FairAsyncSemaphore
extends Object
implements AsyncSemaphore
    An AsyncSemaphore implementation which is strictly fair: if the permits requested by an acquire(long) cannot be fulfilled immediately, all subsequent acquires must wait for their predecessor to be fulfilled. This is the same behavior as a synchronous Semaphore with the fairness parameter set to true.

    The internal permit representation employs fewer than 64 bits to store the (possibly negative) permit count; as a result, the bounds of available permits are restricted. Methods which take a number of permits as an argument are generally restricted to a maximum value of MAX_PERMITS. Similarly, the initial permit value provided to the constructor must be at least as great as the defined MIN_PERMITS value

    • Constructor Detail

      • FairAsyncSemaphore

        public FairAsyncSemaphore(long initialPermits)
        Creates a new asynchronous semaphore with the given initial number of permits. This value may be negative in order to require releases before acquisitions
        Parameters:
        initialPermits - The initial number of permits available in the semaphore. This value must be within the interval [MIN_PERMITS, MAX_PERMITS]

    • Method Detail

      • acquire

        public final CompletionStage<Void> acquire(long permits)
        Acquires the given number of permits using an acquisition-ordered fair queuing policy, i.e. if all the requested permits cannot be fulfilled immediately, the acquisition will enter a FIFO queue. Any subsequent acquisitions will also enter this queue until the head has been fulfilled by sufficient releases.
        Specified by:
        acquire in interface AsyncSemaphore
        Parameters:
        permits - The number of permits to acquire. This value must be greater than 0 and no greater than MAX_PERMITS
        See Also:
        AsyncSemaphore.acquire(long)

      • release

        public final void release(long permits)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncSemaphore
        Releases the given number of permits to the semaphore.

        If there are unfulfilled acquires pending, this method will release permits to the waiting acquisitions based on the implementation's release and acquire policies. Consequently, this method may complete a number of waiting futures and execute the corresponding observers.

        Specified by:
        release in interface AsyncSemaphore
        Parameters:
        permits - The number of permits to release. This value must be greater than 0 and no greater than MAX_PERMITS

      • tryAcquire

        public final boolean tryAcquire(long permits)
        Attempts to acquire the given number of permits if they are immediately available. This attempt honors the fairness policy; if any acquisitions are queued, this method will fail immediately.

        Note that this differs from the behavior of Semaphore.tryAcquire(int) with a fairness policy. This method will not barge ahead of other waiters.

        Specified by:
        tryAcquire in interface AsyncSemaphore
        Parameters:
        permits - The number of permits to acquire. This value must be greater than 0 and no greater than MAX_PERMITS
        Returns:
        true iff all of the requested permits are available, and have been immediately acquired
        See Also:
        AsyncSemaphore.tryAcquire(long)

      • drainPermits

        public final long drainPermits()
        Description copied from interface: AsyncSemaphore
        Acquires all permits that are immediately available.

        After this call -- provided there are no intermediate releases -- any attempt to acquire will queue and any tryAcquire will fail.

        Specified by:
        drainPermits in interface AsyncSemaphore
        Returns:
        the number of permits that were available and have been drained

      • getAvailablePermits

        public final long getAvailablePermits()
        Description copied from interface: AsyncSemaphore
        Returns the number of currently available permits.

        The bounds of the returned value are not defined; an implementation may, for example, choose to represent waiting acquisitions as holding negative permits, and thus the value returned by this method could be negative. Furthermore, a positive number of permits returned by this method may not indicate that such permits are acquirable, as the waiter-queue policy may prohibit fulfilling further acquisitions.

        This value is produced on a best-effort basis, and should not be used for any control logic. Generally it is only useful in testing, debugging, or statistics purposes.

        Specified by:
        getAvailablePermits in interface AsyncSemaphore

      • getQueueLength

        public final int getQueueLength()
        Description copied from interface: AsyncSemaphore
        Returns the number of unfulfilled acquisitions waiting on this semaphore's permits.

        This value is produced on a best-effort basis, and should not be used for any control logic. Generally it is only useful in testing, debugging, or statistics purposes.

        Specified by:
        getQueueLength in interface AsyncSemaphore
